billEvents.eventText: amend and recommit to economic development

title: Grants the state liquor authority general rule making privileges for the purpose of effectuating the alcoholic beverage control law
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                        3411--A

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. SCHIMMINGER, BING, KAVANAGH -- Multi-Sponsored by
         -- M. of A.  BOYLAND, GABRYSZAK, GOTTFRIED, HIKIND, MAGEE, MAGNARELLI,
         WRIGHT -- read once and referred to the Committee on Economic Develop-
         ment  --  committee  discharged,  bill  amended,  ordered reprinted as
         amended and recommitted to said committee

       AN ACT to amend the alcoholic beverage control law, in relation  to  the
         authority  of the state liquor authority to promulgate rules and regu-
         lations; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon  expira-
         tion thereof

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 17 of the alcoholic beverage control law is amended
    2  by adding a new subdivision 15 to read as follows:
    3    15. TO PROMULGATE ANY RULE OR REGULATION NECESSARY  TO  IMPLEMENT  ANY
    4  PROVISION OF THIS CHAPTER.
    5    S  2.  This  act shall take effect immediately and shall expire and be
    6  deemed repealed December 31, 2013.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06365-02-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the alcoholic beverage control law, in relation to the authority of the state liquor authority to promulgate rules and regulations; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof
